content:
TITLE: Running rebuildOpenSilver PowerShell Script
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script command rebuilds the local version of OpenSilver packages and replaces all local NuGet files for OpenSilver and OpenSilver.Simulator with the specified version number. It allows updating the local cache, copying PDB files, and building the simulator component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/scripts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
.\rebuildOpenSilver.ps1 -OS_VERSION 1.0.0-private-2022-03-25 -OS_SIMULATOR_VERSION 1.0.0-private-2022-03-25 -COPY_PDB $true -UPDATE_LOCAL_CACHE $true -BUILD_SIMULATOR $true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building OpenSilver NuGet Package
DESCRIPTION: This batch file compiles the OpenSilver source code and creates NuGet packages. It requires the user to input a version number, typically the current date, to uniquely identify the build.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Batch
CODE:
```
build-nuget-package-OpenSilver.bat
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Package Restoration for OpenSilver
DESCRIPTION: This batch file restores the necessary packages for OpenSilver development. It's a crucial step in the build process, ensuring all dependencies are available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Batch
CODE:
```
restore-packages-opensilver.bat
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating OpenSilver Compiler Assemblies
DESCRIPTION: This batch file updates the OpenSilver compiler assemblies to ensure compatibility with the latest version. It's important to run this after package restoration to prevent compilation or runtime errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Batch
CODE:
```
update-compiler.bat
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting OpenSilver Stable Version Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: Defines an environment variable STABLE_VERSION with the value 3.2.0, representing the current stable release version of the OpenSilver project. This variable is likely referenced in build scripts and deployment workflows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/build/version_info.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
STABLE_VERSION=3.2.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Execution Policy for PowerShell Scripts
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command changes the execution policy to RemoteSigned to allow script execution on the local machine. This is required before running the rebuildOpenSilver.ps1 script if PowerShell restrictions are in place.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/scripts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
Set-ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Table of New Analyzer Rules in OpenSilver 1.0.0
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table displaying information about new analyzer rules introduced in OpenSilver 1.0.0. The table contains columns for Rule ID, Category, Severity, and Notes, showing details for the OS0001 NotImplementedAnalyzer rule.
SOURCE: https://github.com/opensilver/opensilver/blob/develop/src/Analyzers/NotImplemented/AnalyzerReleases.Shipped.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Rule ID | Category | Severity | Notes
--------|----------|----------|-------
OS0001 | Compatibility | Warning | NotImplementedAnalyzer
```
